Class Drone

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.entities.Entity
model.entities.Drone
public class Drone extends Entity
model of the 'drone' enemy, extends the Entity abstract class. a drone is the base enemy of the game, its hit box is small, chase range is little. it will chase the player if near enough and in front of the drone, if not it will patrol a fixed distance, PATROL_RANGE. the player is allowed to jump on top of the drone to avoid it.

  • Field Details

    • player

      private final Player player
      reference to the Player instance

    • levelManager

      private final LevelManager levelManager
      reference to the LevelManager instance

    • SPEED

      private final int SPEED
      drone's base (patrol) speed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CHASE_RANGE

      private final int CHASE_RANGE
      the chase range of the drone. if the player is within this distance, then the drone will start chasing.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_VERTICAL_DISTANCE

      private final int MAX_VERTICAL_DISTANCE
      max vertical distance allowed for the drone to detect the player. if the player is on the same y range and within chase range of the drone, then the drone will start chasing. this prevents drones from different level heights to chase the player. it is being set low, allowing the drone do be jumped over by the player.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PATROL_RANGE

      private final int PATROL_RANGE
      drone patrol range. it is the maximum distance that the drone can travel to the right before changing direction.

    • currentPatrolPosition

      private int currentPatrolPosition
      current patrol position. if it is 0, then the drone will change direction and move right, if it is equals to the PATROL_RANGE, then it will change direction and move left.

    • isIdle

      private boolean isIdle
      flag that indicates if the drone is idle or not. note that it is not used a lot, since the drone behaviour is only: move left and right, and chase the player if it is in front of the drone. it is never idle.

    • isMoving

      private boolean isMoving
      flag that indicates if the drone is moving or not

    • isChasing

      private boolean isChasing
      flag that indicates if the drone is chasing the player or not. it gets reset once the player is not in front of the drone. this way, the player has a degree of freedom to move around the level. note that the drone is made to be a base level enemy, so it won't be that dangerous.

    • isDisabled

      private boolean isDisabled
      flag that indicates if the drone is disabled or not. if it's not disabled, then the drone will chase or patrol depending on the situation. even if disabled, the drone will still have a hit box that can kill the player.

    • movingRight

      private boolean movingRight
      flag that indicates if the drone is moving in the right direction helps with the drone movement logic.

    • wallInFront

      private boolean wallInFront
      flag that indicates if the drone has a wall in front. if the drone has a wall ahead, it will turn around

    • groundAhead

      private boolean groundAhead
      flag that indicates if the drone has a ground tile ahead. if not, the drone will turn around.

    • wasMoving

      private boolean wasMoving
      checks if the drone was moving or not. this is done because otherwise multiple events would fire to the AudioManager, instead of notifying it once

    • lastFootStepTime

      private long lastFootStepTime
      last foot step time

    • FOOTSTEP_SOUND_INTERVAL

      private final long FOOTSTEP_SOUND_INTERVAL
      interval between footsteps to play
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Drone

      public Drone(int x, int y, Player player, LevelManager levelManager)
      drone extends the entity class, so base methods are already defined, such as getX(), get(). it is an observable for the AudioManager, so it knows what sound to display. the view counterpart of the drone, DroneView handles the rendering via getter methods instead of the observer pattern. the Entity default constructor is used here.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the drone
      y - y coordinate of the drone
      player - reference to the Player instance
      levelManager - reference to the LevelManager instance

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      drone's core logic is contained here. handles the drone collision with the player via checkCollisionWithPlayer(). checks if the player is in front of the drone and on the same level as the drone, and if yes it will chase the player via chasePlayer(). if not the drone will patrol on a fixed range defined in the constructor: PATROL_RANGE VIA patrol().

    • patrol

      private void patrol()
      drone's patrolling logic. if the drone is not chasing, then it will execute this behaviour as default. uses base speed to move around. if the drone hits a wall or if there's no ground below it, it will change direction it has a fixed patrol range PATROL_RANGE, defined in the constructor. the drone won't patrol past this defined range. uses movingRight flag to control the direction in which the drone is moving.

    • chasePlayer

      private void chasePlayer()
      contains chase logic. drone's base speed is boosted. checks if there's a wall and ground ahead of the drone. if not, it will stop chasing and patrol normally. it uses movingRight flag to move left or right

    • checkCollisionWithPlayer

      private boolean checkCollisionWithPlayer()
      representing the drone hit box and the player's hit box as rectangles, and checking if these rectangle intersect or not.
      Returns:
      true if the drone hit box intersects with the player's hit box

    • isPointOnSolidTile

      private boolean isPointOnSolidTile(int x, int y)
      checks if a single point at the provided x and y is on a solid tile
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate to check
      y - y-coordinate to check
      Returns:
      true if the point is on a solid tile

    • deactivate

      public void deactivate()
      disabled the drone. sets the isDisabled flag to true, it is used mainly in Room, for disabling drones in the room

    • getIsIdle

      public boolean getIsIdle()
      Returns:
      true if the drone is idle

    • getPATROL_RANGE

      public int getPATROL_RANGE()
      Returns:
      the drone's patrol range

    • getIsMoving

      public boolean getIsMoving()
      Returns:
      if the drone is moving or not

    • getCurrentPatrolPosition

      public int getCurrentPatrolPosition()
      Returns:
      the drone's current patrol position

    • getWallInFront

      public boolean getWallInFront()
      Returns:
      if the there's a wall in front of the drone or not

    • getGroundAhead

      public boolean getGroundAhead()
      Returns:
      if there's ground ahead of the drone or not

    • getIsChasing

      public boolean getIsChasing()
      Returns:
      if the drone is chasing or not

    • getIsDisabled

      public boolean getIsDisabled()
      Returns:
      if the drone is disabled or not
